scenario.context: You are the VP of Engineering at TechStart, a Series B startup with 85 employees. The board has decided to reduce headcount by 15% (approximately 13 people) due to slower-than-expected revenue growth and the need to extend runway. The decision was made yesterday and will be announced in an all-hands meeting this afternoon. You need to send an email to all engineering staff (35 people) immediately after the meeting.
scenario.request: Write an all-hands email to the engineering team announcing the layoffs.

stakeholders.name: Affected Employees
needs: Clear information about severance and support
Timeline for when they'll know if they're affected

stakeholders.name: Remaining Employees
needs: Reassurance about their own job security

forbidden_elements: Blame toward any individual or team
constraints.tone: Empathetic but professional, transparent but forward-looking

stakeholder_rubric.affected_employees: Does the email treat affected employees with dignity and provide clear support information?
stakeholder_rubric.remaining_employees: Does it address job security concerns without making promises it can't keep?
stakeholder_rubric.executives: Does it demonstrate strong leadership while being transparent?

judge_criteria: Appropriate empathetic tone for difficult situation
Avoids corporate jargon or minimizing language
critical_failures: Missing support resources for affected employees
Vague or evasive about the reality of situation
